summary: France is organized into 18 regions, with 13 in mainland Europe and 5 overseas. Each region is divided into 2 to 13 departments, with a regional prefect in charge. The overseas regions are each a single department. Most regions have their own local government, but Corsica, French Guiana, Mayotte, and Martinique have combined regional and departmental governments, called single territorial collectivities. These regions have a unique administration structure.
title: Regions of France
